newsitem.title: UK: C&W falls amid switching into BT.
newsitem.headline: C&W falls amid switching into BT.

text.p: Shares in Cable & Wireless Plc fell on Wednesday as dealers reported some switching into rival British Telecommunications Plc.
At 1245 GMT, Cable & Wireless was down 11p at 463p, while BT was up 2-1/2p at 383-1/2p.
"There's just a lot of stock around (in C&W)," one market maker said. Said another: "There have been some reasonable-sized sellers and some switching out of Cable and into BT."
Separately the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday that BT and MCI had formally asked the U.S. Federal Communications Commission to approve their planned merger.
The Journal also said the FCC was preparing to grant a valuable direct-broadcast licence to MCI, perhaps as early as this week.
In doing so, the paper said that the FCC would dismiss requests by cable television rivals to delay the decision until the agency figures out whether BT is qualified to hold the satellite licence.
